jbt.tools.btlibrarygenerator.lowlevelgenerator
Class CommonCodeGenerationUtilities

java.lang.Object
  jbt.tools.btlibrarygenerator.lowlevelgenerator.CommonCodeGenerationUtilities

public class CommonCodeGenerationUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

Some helper functions used for easily generating String representations of ModelActions, ModelConditions, ExecutionActions and ExecutionConditions from MMPM actions and sensors.

ActionsGenerator and ConditionsGenerator share most of their functionality, so this class just gathers all of the common parts when they are generating classes.

Author:
Ricardo Juan Palma Dur√°n
See Also:
ActionsGenerator, ConditionsGenerator

Method Detail

getClassVariables

static java.lang.String getClassVariables(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Class,java.lang.String>> params)
Given a list of class "parameters", this method returns a String representation of the declaration of those parameters as private members of a class.

params contains all the parameters. Each Pair represents a parameter, being the first element its class and the second element its name.

The returned representation is tabulated one unit.

Parameters:
params - the set of parameters from which a String representation is created.
Returns:
a String representation of the declaration of the parameters in params.

getModelConstructor

static java.lang.String getModelConstructor(java.lang.String modelClassName,
                                            java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Class,java.lang.String>> params)
Creates a String expression for the constructor of a ModelAction or ModelCondition. The name of the class is modelClassName, and params is a list of parameters (the first element of each pair is the class of the parameter and the second element is its name).

For each parameter of name pName in params, the constructor will receive two parameters, one of name pName, whose type is that specified in the list of parameters, and another one of name pNameLoc, whose type is String, and which represents the place in the context where pName must be looked for in case a value is not specified for it.

The constructor assigns the value of every input argument to its corresponding class variable.

Parameters:
modelClassName - the name of the ModelAction or ModelCondition class whose constructor is going to be created.
params - the list of parameters to be used when building the constructor.
Returns:
a String expression for the constructor, as described above.

getExecutionConstructor

static java.lang.String getExecutionConstructor(java.lang.String executionClassName,
                                                java.lang.String modelClassPackageName,
                                                java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Class,java.lang.String>> params)
Creates a String expression for the constructor of a ExecutionAction or ExecutionCondition. The name of the class is executionClassName, and params is a list of parameters (the first element of each pair is the class of the parameter and the second element is its name).

For each parameter of name pName in params, the constructor will receive two parameters, one of name pName, whose type is that specified in the list of parameters, and another one of name pNameLoc, whose type is String, and which represents the place in the context where pName must be looked for in case a value is not specified for it.

The constructor assigns the value of every input argument to its corresponding class variable.

modelClassPackageName is the name of the package that contains the corresponding model class (the name of the corresponding model class is assumed to be executionClassName.

Parameters:
executionClassName - the name of the ModelAction or ModelCondition class whose constructor is going to be created.
params - the list of parameters to be used when building the constructor.
modelClassPackageName - the name of the package that contains the corresponding model class.
Returns:
a String expression for the constructor, as described above.

getCreateExecutorMethod

static java.lang.String getCreateExecutorMethod(java.lang.String executionClassName,
                                                java.lang.String executionClassPackageName,
                                                java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Class,java.lang.String>> params)
This method creates a String representing the definition of the ModelTask.createExecutor(BTExecutor, ExecutionTask) method of a class.

The method will return an instance of an ExecutionTask whose name is executionClassName and placed in the package executionActionPackageName.

params represents the list of parameters that the ExecutionTask will receive in its constructor. The first argument that is passed to the ExecutionTask's constructor is this; the second argument is executor (executor represents the BTExecutor that is passed to the createExecutor() method. The rest of the parameters that are passed to the constructor are those in params. Each Pair in params represents a parameter, being the first element its class and the second element its name. For each parameter in params, the constructor receives two parameters, the parameter itself (for instance pName) , and the location of the parameter in the context (pNameLoc ).

Parameters:
executionClassName - the name of the ExecutionTask that the method will return.
params - the list of parameters that the ExecutionTask executionClassName will receive in its constructor, apart from this and executor .
executionClassPackageName - the name of the Java package that contains the class executionClassName.
Returns:
a String representation for the createExecutor() method as described above.

getGetters

static java.lang.String getGetters(java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Class,java.lang.String>> params)
Given a list of parameters, this method creates an expression declaring a public getter method for each parameter. These getters must be used by a class extending ExecutionTask, since the implementation of such getters make use of the context of the task.

params contains all the parameters. Each Pair represents a parameter, being the first element its class and the second element its name.

Given a parameter of name pName, the getter function has as a name getPName(). If the variable to get is not null, the getter method returns the variable. Otherwise, it searches for the variable in the context by using the class private variable getPNameLoc.

Parameters:
params - the set of parameters from which getters are going to be obtained.
Returns:
a String representation of all the getters for the parameters in params

getGetter

static java.lang.String getGetter(Pair<java.lang.Class,java.lang.String> param)
Given a parameter, this method returns a getter method for it. This getter must be used by a class extending ExecutionTask, since the implementation of such getter make use of the context of the task.

param represents the parameter, being the first element its class and the second element its name.

Given a parameter of name pName, the getter function has as a name getPName(). If the variable to get is not null, the getter method returns the variable. Otherwise, it searches for the variable in the context by using the class private variable getPNameLoc.

Parameters:
param - the parameter from which the getter method is obtained.
Returns:
a String representation for the parameter param.

getAbstractMethods

static java.lang.String getAbstractMethods()
Returns a String representation of the declaration of the abstract methods of the ExecutionTask class. The String is tabulated one unit.

Returns:
a String representation of the declaration of the abstract methods of the ExecutionTask class.
